Product/service name: Guide (Please delete these rows before uploading)
Choose this name carefully. This will appear on your Products & services page and on sales channels you connect to QuickBooks.
Category:
Use categories to group similar items together.

You can create sub-categories by separating category names with a colon, like: Shirts:Smart Button Shirts. Sub-categories can be up to 4 levels deep.
Item type:
Keep these guidelines in mind for type:

 - Use Non-Inventory for physical products you don't need to track quantities of.
 - Use Service for the professional services your business offers.
- Use Inventory for physical products you need to track quantities of.
Taxable: Indicate whether this product or service is taxable.
SKU: Use SKU or stock keeping unit to distinguish between items. A SKU is a string of numbers and letters that is unique to each item.
Sales description: This description will appear on sales forms and reports. It should help you and your customers identify the product.
Sales price/rate: Enter the price or rate your customers will pay for this product or service.
Income account: Enter the income account in your chart of accounts where you want sales transactions to appear.
Purchase description: Enter a description of the product vendors will see when you purchase it.
Purchase cost: Enter the price you pay when you buy the product from your suppliers.
Expense account: Enter the expense account in your chart of accounts where you want purchase transactions to appear.
Quantity on hand: Enter the quantity on hand for Inventory items.
Quantity as of date: If this is left empty, it will reflect the date when you upload and import this spreadsheet.
Reorder point: Enter the Inventory quantity at which we'll remind you to purchase more stock.
Inventory asset account: Enter the Inventory asset account in your chart of accounts where you record the value of the products you're selling.
